text: Thomas "Tommy" Gemmell (16 October 1943 - 2 March 2017) was a Scottish football player and manager. He served as a left-sided fullback and had powerful shooting ability. Gemmell is best known as one of the Celtic side who won the 1966-67 European Cup; he scored the first Celtic goal in the final. Gemmell played 18 times for Scotland, and also played for Nottingham Forest, Miami Toros and Dundee. After retiring as a player in 1977, Gemmell managed Dundee and Albion Rovers. Gemmell died on 2 March 2017, aged 73, after a long illness. ==References== ==Other websites== * Newcastle Fans profile Category:1943 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Scottish football managers Category:Footballers from North Lanarkshire Category:Nottingham Forest F.C. players
title: Tommy Gemmell
